title: obidome
body:
Obidome (帯留め, おびどめ) are small brooches worn threaded onto the obijime, making a charming decoration on the front of the obi. Can be made of wood, ceramic, resin, mother-of-pearl, or precious metals. Often in designs such as flowers, small objects, or animals.
The back surface will almost always be flat with two closely-spaced raised rectangular holes, used for sliding the obidome over the thin flat obijime cord.

When an obijime is made specifically to be worn with obidome, it will be thinner and flatter than average, and known as sanbu-himo.

These are generally the only jewelry that is acceptable to wear with kimono (other than a wedding band or tasteful watch). Typically an informal item, even when made with precious gems and are only acceptable with more casual or funky outfits. 

However, Maiko will wear a very large and elaborate form of obidome known as pocchiri with their hikizuri. These are often made of incredibly fine materials such as gold and diamonds or emeralds, as well as very detailed enamel workmanship. They are also much larger than normal obidome.


h4. External link 

* "Kimono breakdown":https://i.pinimg.com/736x/e1/ae/33/e1ae334d27775ba95b8753a054e2a168--traditional-japanese-kimono-traditional-dresses.jpg

* "Obidome being worn":http://www.immortalgeisha.com/wiki/images/c/c5/Obidome_being_worn.jpg

* [[Japanese clothes]]

title: montgomery_(milihime_taisen)
body:
Bernard Law Montgomery was a British Army Officer. He is famous for commanding the British 8th Army in North Africa, the command of allied units in Operation Overlord, and the failed invasion of Operation Market Garden.

In [[Milihime Taisen]], Montgomery is depicted as an [[AEC Armored Command Vehicle]] [[mecha musume]], who has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]] and enjoys [[teacup|tea]]. She wears a [[beret]], a [[bandana]] or [[scarf]], a [[sweater]], and [[shorts]]. Because of her first CG, she is sometimes depicted being under [[shade]].

title: yashima_yuzu
body:
[b]Game:[/b] [[Class Zenin Maji de Yuri?!]]

One of the heroines in MajiYuri. The standard "looks younger than she is and gets insecure about it" character, though her looks come in handy working at a [[gothic lolita]] maid cafe. She's a [[red hair|redhead]] with a puffy little [[ahoge]] -- and [[twintails]], because [i]everybody has twintails[/i] in this game.

title: kenshin_kagemitsu
body:
A [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] character.

He is based off of an unnamed [[tantou]] once in the possession of [[Uesugi Kenshin]]. On its base was engraved the  phrase "Chichibu Daibosatsu" (秩父大菩薩) in Sanskrit.

His in-game character is based around maturity, and lives by a code of self-control. While he believes that self-control is the key to being adult, his own shortcomings cause him to act childish.

Voiced by [[Yonaga Tsubasa]]. Character designer is [[Homerun Ken]].

title: excalibur_(soul_eater)
body:
Character from [[Soul Eater]]; his legend began in the 12th century. Voiced by [[Koyasu Takehito]] (JP) and Troy Baker (EN).

Much like his counterpart in Arturian legend, he takes on the form of a powerful [[sword]] when in the hands of a Meister.

Such strength, however, comes at a price; Excalibur is extremely abrasive, annoying, and an egotistical attention seeker that very few Meisters stay with him for long.

Thanks to his attention-seeking antics (complete with his own theme song, too) people who have encountered Excalibur in all his irritating glory have a facial expression reserved for it (the [[Excalibur face]]).

title: crow_(show_by_rock!!)
body:
Lead vocalist and guitarist for the band ShinganCrimsonZ in [i][[Show By Rock!!]][/i]. 

He acts as a little brother to the band, often being loud, brash, and somewhat defensive about his farm-boy upbringing. It was his idea to call his fans "cattle" based on this.

Has [[multicolored_hair|multicolored]] [[red_hair|red]] and [[black_hair|black]] hair, and tends to wear a red [[trench coat]].


Apparently some sort of Hedgehog.

title: kitajima_sara
body: A character from the [[yuri]] eroge series [[Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo]].  Paired with [[Kitajima Kaede]], her older cousin.  She currently works as a very well-known model.  Something of a crybaby who worked hard to become more outgoing and self-reliant out of her adoration and love for Kaede.

title: kitajima_kaede
body: A character from the [[yuri]] eroge series [[Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo]].  Paired with [[Kitajima Sara]].  Kaede is a well-known and respected member of the student body, but is extremely uncomfortable being the center of attention of any sort, and takes care not to stand out too much in any fashion.  Her tendency to fade into the background often clashes with Sara's outgoing and naturally attention-drawing personality.

title: sawaguchi_mai
body: A character from the [[yuri]] eroge series [[Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo]].  Paired with [[Kawamura Reo]].  An outgoing, good-natured girl from a warm, middle-class family.  After Reo confesses her feelings, Mai becomes the aggressor in the relationship, much to Reo's continuing embarrassment.

title: kawamura_reo
body: A character from the [[yuri]] eroge series [[Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo]].  Paired with [[Sawaguchi Mai]].  A short [[tsundere]] who constantly argues with Mai, she suddenly confesses her feelings one day after classes.  She is popular with her classmates because of her small demeanor and doll-like beauty, but she is also feared for her harsh temper.  A willful girl who has a tendency to live on convenience store junk food, which is only exacerbated by the tensions between her well-to-do parents.

title: daruma_otoshi
body:
A toy consisting of a small mallet, and a stack of wooden disks with a wooden [[Daruma doll]] on top. The goal of the game is to hit the disks, knocking one out and dropping the Daruma a space without causing the stack to fall. It's featured somewhat prominently in [[Nichijou]]. 

* "English Wikipedia entry":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daruma_doll#Children.27s_games
* "Japanese Wikipedia entry":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%A0%E3%82%8B%E3%81%BE#.E3.81.A0.E3.82.8B.E3.81.BE.E8.90.BD.E3.81.A8.E3.81.97

title: cyou_shigen
body:
An [[original]] character by [[Beifeng Han]].

The artist has also called her Zoeng Zijyun, the Cantonese pronunciation of her name.

She has long [[blonde_hair]], and [[red_eyes]]. She is [[Miyaura Sanshio]]'s friend.


For her Self-Introduction, her profile says:

[b]Original:[/b]

[quote]はじめまして、張子源です！
14歲です
源ちゃんは三汐の友たちです~[/quote] 

[b]Translation:[/b]

[quote]Nice to meet you, I'm Cyou Shigen!
I'm 14 years old.
Gen-chan is Shanshio's friend![/quote] 

Translation credits: Moonspeaker

title: rafaga
body:
[b]Rafaga[/b] (Spanish for "Burst") is a transformable variable mecha from the [[Choukou Senki Kikaiou]] (超鋼戦紀キカイオー) videogame.

It was created by [[Kawamori Shouji]].

title: nippon_ichi
body:
Nippon Ichi Software, sometimes shortened as simply "NIS", is a Japanese video game developer company known for their anime-styled series of SRPGs. Though largely stand-alone, most games appear to be connected in some form through parallel dimensions or some such and crossovers are normal. Most recently, there was even a crossover character between NIS’ [[Soul Cradle|Soul Nomad]] (Which also featured characters from other NIS games) and Vanillaware’s [[GrimGrimoire|GrimGrimoire]]. Most of the character designs have been done by [[ryoji_(nomura_ryouji)|Nomura Ryoji]] and [[Harada Takehito]].

h4.See also

* [[List of Nippon Ichi characters]]

title: poltergust_3000
body:
The Poltergust 3000 is a [[vacuum cleaner]] invented by Professor E. Gadd/Oya Maa to catch [[ghost]]s that is first seen in [[Luigi's Mansion]]. In Japanese it is called the "Obakyuumu", a play on words combining "obake" (ghost) and "bakyuumu" (vacuum).

See also "Mario Wiki":http://www.mariowiki.com/Poltergust_3000

title: debauchery_in_caelia_kingdoms
body:
Debauchery in Caelia Kingdoms is (mostly) a text adventure game where you play as the new governor of a city that is facing monsters and a mind-corrupting disease.

Will you fight against these threats or embrace them and bring change and chaos into the city? 

https://maratdev.tumblr.com/DiCK

title: yamine_aku
body:
h4. Yamine Aku (闇音アク)

A fanmade Vocaloid based on [[Vocalod]] [[Hatsune Miku]]. She is [[dark skin]]ned, has [[purple eyes]], and has long [[white hair]] in [[twintails]]. There are two versions of her; a young version that wears a dark-purple [[gothic lolita]]-style outfit. And an older version, in which she wears a leather [[swimsuit]], long jacket and [[thigh boots]].

She is also termed as an "Anti-Vocaloid" or "X-loid".

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

h4. External links

* Official page: http://www.flowrish.com/x-loid/

title: narwhal_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

The Narwhal ([i]Monodon monoceros[/i]) is a medium-sized toothed whale known for their massive tusk, usually a left canine. Note that the males are typically the ones with a tusk. Females do, however, occasionally grow a tusk. They live in the Arctic seas.

Narwhal (the Friend) wears a [[sailor dress]] with the distinctive pattern of the Narwhal, fitting with the usual "Marine Fashion" motif of the cetacean Friends. She wields right-handedly a lance or sword based on the Narwhal's tusk. Her hair is styled like the front and fins of the Narwhal, including a blowhole and a long lock of hair to her left representing her actual tusk. Of course, she has the tail of the Narwhal.
other_names: イッカク(けものフレンズ)

title: suou_amane
body:
周防天音 (すおう あまね)
Character from the [[grisaia (series)|Grisaia]] franchise.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] with a [[hair bow]] creating [[hair rings]] at each side, and [[blue eyes]]. Has a tall figure and [[large breasts]].

The only 3rd year student at Mihama Academy, she has a cheerful personality and often acts as an elder sister to the other students.

She likes driving and vehicles; she holds a car and a motorcycle license.

title: sichte_meister
body:
Sichte is the leader of the RKS Strike Force, a special portion of RKS, from the Doujin soft [[Rosenkreuzstilette]]. She is a mature, level-headed decision maker with keen judgment who has trouble having faith in those older than her. She is good friends with [[Grolla Seyfarth]] and dreams of a world where Magi can live peacefully.

Her weapon, the Die Geplante Zukunft, allows her to stop time. She also has an endless supply of knives that she can place all over the place when time is stopped, having them home in on her opponent. Because of this power, she is homage to [[Dio Brando]] from [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]], much like [[Izayoi Sakuya]] from the [[Touhou]] series and Zephyr from [[Castlevania: Dawn of Sorrow]], who both also have similar abilities to Dio.

She is also known for her [[large breasts]] as well. In [[Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel]], her clothes have been torn and she now also wears a black bra underneath her torn shirt as well as black [[armbands]].

title: bionic_commando
body:
[b]Bionic Commando[/b] is a series of [[military]] and [[science fiction]] [[video game]] action series created by [[Capcom]] company.

The first game in the series was released in Japan as [b]Top Secret[/b] (Japanese: トップシークレット,, Hepburn: Toppu Shīkuretto?), a 1987 action platform game released for the arcades. It was later released for several home computers (ported by Software Creations and published by Go!). The music from the arcade game was created by female composer Fujita Harumi.

Capcom later produced a home version for the [[NES]] console titled Bionic Commando that was drastically different from the original arcade game. This version included some songs from the arcade as well as original new music created by female composer Tamiya Junko. Her soundtrack has become famous over the years and is still considered one of the best and most recognizable videogame music ever made.  

The game was advertised in the United States as a sequel to Commando, going as far to refer to the game's main character as Super Joe (the protagonist of Commando) in the promotional brochure, who was originally an unnamed member of a "special commando unit" in the Japanese and World versions.

The series is notable for being one of few instances of a platform game in which the player cannot jump. To cross gaps or climb ledges, the [[cyborg]] hero must use his bionic arm. This was the first game to feature a grappling gun/hook, which later appeared in games such as Earthworm Jim and Tomb Raider.

A version of the NES game was released in 1992 for the [[Game Boy]] handheld console. A [[Game Boy Color]] game called [b]Bionic Commando: Elite Forces[/b] was released in 1999. Another remake of the NES version called [b]Bionic Commando Rearmed[/b] was released for Xbox Live Arcade, PlayStation Network and Windows in 2008. 

A direct third person action sequel to the classic Bionic Commando and its enhanced remake was released in 2009 for the [[Playstation 3]] and the [[Xbox 360]] home consoles. A more immediate sequel to Rearmed was released for the Xbox Live Arcade and the PlayStation Network in 2011.

h4. See also

* [[Nathan Spencer]]

title: japanese_otter_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

The Japanese Otter ([i]Lutra nippon[/i]) is, obviously, the Japanese variant of the Eurasian Otter. The species has been officially considered to be extinct in 2012, the last official sighting being in 1979. However, there has been several unofficial sightings of the animal ever since.

Japanese Otter (The Friend) resembles an orangish-brown haired and costumed [[small-clawed_otter_(kemono_friends)|Small-Clawed Otter]] with the main differences aside from color being shorter bangs and a shy demeanor. Considered extinct, [[empty_eyes|she also lacks the shine of her eyes]].

News of video sightings on Tsushima Island of an indeterminate otter (either a bonafide Japanese Otter or a migrating Eurasian Otter) in February 2017 lead to some hope for the Japanese Otter. In turn, this sparked a trend to draw her with highlights on her eyes, including producing them at the sight of the actual animal.
other_names: ニホンカワウソ(けものフレンズ)

title: shinsha-chan
body:
Official name: シンシャ (Shinsha) 
Pixiv tag: しゃちっ娘 (Shachikko, lit. Orca-girl)

An original Orca-girl first created by [[Shinkai no Shachi]] ("Deep-sea Orca"). She is a tall young lady with [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] that [[ahoge|sticks up at the top]], and with [[two side up|small portions tied off on each side]] using round, white [[hair ornament]]s, resembling the head and fins of a [[orca|killer whale]]. She wears a [[long dress|long]] [[white dress]] and [[sandals]] - sometimes her dress is [[strapless dress|strapless]], sometimes not. Some depictions give her black bracelets that look strikingly similar to [[Ikamusume]]'s blue bangles, though she is most often drawn without them.

She has no [[monster girl|non-human]] features, making her a completely [[personification|personified]] killer whale.

While the Pixiv tag that refers to her just means "Orca-girl", she remains the sole occupant of the tag. Use discretion if this ever changes.

h4. See Also

* [[Shinkai no Shachi]]
* [[Orca]]
* [[fish girl]]
* [[personification]]

title: cthugha_(nyaruko-san)
body:
[b]"The Living Flame"[/b]

She is one of the characters of the series [[Haiyore! Nyaruko-san]]. A being of Ctugha, she has the ability to control [[fire]]. She's deeply in love with [[Nyarlathotep (Nyaruko-san)|Nyaruko]], despite bad relations between the Ctughan and the Nyarlathotepan races. She's a [[NEET]], and is deeply obsessed with [[video game]]s. Being a Ctughan, she disguises herself with the form of a [[red_hair|red haired]] girl with twintails, and [[red eyes]].

title: temi_(konagona_moe)
body:
Artist well known for his "smashing female statues to pieces" fetish, also known as 粉々萌え([i]Konagona Moe[/i]). He is also interested in [[monster]]s from Japanese [[urban legends]] and [[Oomuro Sakurako]] x [[Akaza Akari]] pairing.
 
No matter how unusual Temi's fetish is, this artist is a person of common sense. He is making best efforts to not scare people by his images found by accident. That's why his pixiv images have no character / copyright tags.

title: tetrapodal_mecha_panther
body:
A character from the [[Strider (video game)]] franchise. It appears in the original Strider arcade videogame from 1989 as well as the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series of fighting games released years later.

The [b]Tetrapodal Mecha Panther[/b] (also known as [b]Option B[/b]) is a combat [[robot]] [[smilodon]] that helps the main character [[Strider Hiryuu]] during his quest. It is formed by the union of two [[Dipodal Saucer]] robots (also known as [i]Option A[/i]) after the proper [[transformation]] power up is obtained.

title: lifestealer_(dota)
body:
[b]N'aix[/b] the [b]Lifestealer[/b] is a vicious melee Strength hero whose abilities give him the power to bring down durable heroes quickly, while sustaining his health from absorbing the very life of his enemies.

[b]Lore:[/b] 	In the dungeons of Devarque, a vengeful wizard lay in shackles, plotting his escape. He shared his cell with a gibbering creature known as N'aix, a thief cursed by the Vile Council with longevity, so that its life-sentence for theft and cozening might be as punishing as possible. Over the years, its chains had corroded, along with its sanity; N'aix retained no memory of its former life and no longer dreamt of escape. Seeing a perfect vessel for his plans, the wizard wove a spell of Infestation and cast his life-force into N'aix's body, intending to compel N'aix to sacrifice itself in a frenzy of violence while the mage returned to his body and crept away unnoticed. Instead, the wizard found his mind caught in a vortex of madness so powerful that it swept away his plans and shattered his will. Jarred to consciousness by the sudden infusion of fresh life, N'aix woke from its nightmare of madness and obeyed the disembodied voice that filled its skull, which had only the one thought: To escape. In that moment Lifestealer was born. The creature cast its mind into dungeon guards and soldiers, compelling them to open locks and cut down their companions, opening an unobstructed path to freedom while feeding on their lives. Lifestealer still wears the broken shackles as a warning that none may hold him, but on the inside remains a prisoner. Two minds inhabit the single form--a nameless creature of malevolent cunning, and the Master whose voice he pretends to obey.

title: tasmanian_devil_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

The Tasmanian Devil ([i]Sarcophilus harrisii[/i]) is a Marsupial resembling somewhat a wolverine and was mistakenly known as a fearsome, ravenous beast. They originally evolved in mainland Australia but they were extirpated and relegated to Tasmania thousands of years before the present. (See "[[australian_devil_(kemono_friends)|Australian Devil]]")

She appears briefly in Episode 2 as one of the several Friends encountered in the Jungle Area, simply presenting herself with an adorably menacing pose.
other_names: タスマニアデビル(けものフレンズ)

title: tsuneki_hikari
body:
Character from the 2017 original anime [[Seiren]]. 

Has dark [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] that's tied into a [[side ponytail]] on her left. She wears no cardigan, only a basic [[white shirt]].

From "the early character reveals on ANN":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-11-25/seiren-original-anime-reveals-3-more-cast-members-character-designs/.109183 :
[quote]
ANN said:
A "modern day meddling princess." She is always cheerful and is the class idol of class 2-B at Teruhi Higashi High School. She was the runner-up of last year's "Miss Santa Contest," and has an exclusive seat on the terrace. She loves to eat, and is occasionally stubborn.
[/quote]

She is voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

title: bonsly
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #438 in the National Pokédex, a Rock type baby Pokémon
Bonsai-like in appearance, it is actually made of rock, evident in the unnatural roundness of its features.

Baby; evolves into [[Sudowoodo]] when knowing the move [i]mimic[/i] when leveled up.
Japanese name: Usohachi

Prior Pokémon: [[Bronzong]]
Next Pokémon: [[Mime Jr.]]

title: happiny
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #440 in the National PokéDex, a Normal type Pokémon. 
Happiny is a small Pokémon that is shaped like an egg. It has a soft, smooth, light pink body.

It evolves into [[Chansey]] when leveled up holding the [i]Oval Stone[/i] during daytime.
Japanese Name: [b]Pinpuku[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Mime Jr.]]
Next Pokémon: [[Chatot]]

title: ohgotwhai
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] series. He appears in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008.

[b]Major Ohgotwhai[/b] is an alien [[Zentradi]] [[giant]] [[commander]] who looks a lot like [[Vrlitwhai Kridanik]] from the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] animated movie from 1984. He is also a [[cyborg]].

h4. See also

* [[Major Ohgotwhai's Advisor]]

title: bilrer
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] series. He appears in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008.

[b]Bilrer[/b] is an alien [[Zentradi]] [[giant]] mogul who owns the [[S.M.S.]] private army. 

He looks a lot like an older version of [[Vrlitwhai Kridanik]] from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982. Bilrer is also a [[cyborg]].

title: suzuka_hime
body:
A playable character in Super Robot Taisen - OG Saga: Endless Frontier. She is voiced by [[Noto Mamiko]].

Princess of the Shiki-Oni kingdom, she joins [[Harken Browning]] and [[Nanbu Kaguya]] to discover the mystery of their worlds, and why her fiance is acting rather strangely.

She dances while using her fans in battle, alongside Jyaki-GUN-Oh, a heavily-armed combat puppet made to look like a mech.

Is [[flat_chest|flat]], but don't tell her that to her face.

title: rhapsodia
body: A side story to [i][[Gensou Suikoden IV]][/i]. [i]Rhapsodia​[/i], titled [i]Suikoden Tactics[/i] in the English translation, is a tactical RPG that takes place shortly after [i]Gensou Suikoden IV[/i]. Its main purpose is to explain the origin and nature of [i]Gensou Suikoden IV[/i]'s Rune Cannons, and to explain why those powerful weapons are no longer commonplace in the other games of the [i][[Gensou Suikoden]][/i] series (all of which take place well after [i]Gensou Suikoden IV[/i]).

title: osana_najimi_(yandere_simulator)
body: Osana Najimi is a character set to be featured in the sandbox game [[Yandere Simulator]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] in [[twintails]], and wears [[print legwear|print]] [[thighhighs]]. She will be a rival of [[ayano aishi|Yandere-chan]] due her crush on her childhood friend, [[Senpai_(yandere_simulator)|Senpai]].

title: homurakko
body:
[[Animalization]] of [[Akemi Homura]] into an [[otter]]. It was created by [[tamute (2580rs)]] to complement [[Gomadoka]], an animalization of [[Kaname Madoka]] as a seal.

Homurakko is a pun, combining "Homura" with "rakko" (ラッコ), a Japanese word for sea otter. 

h4. See also

* [[Gomadoka]], an animalization of [[Kaname Madoka]] as a seal.
* [[Mamikurage]], an animalization of [[Tomoe Mami]] as a jellyfish.
* [[Sayakaba]], an animalization of [[Miki Sayaka]] as a hippopotamus.

title: kebiishi_(touken_ranbu)
body:
Powerful enemies in the [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] universe. Although they resemble the [[jikan sokougun|historical revisionists]] in appearance, they are notably stronger. Their purpose is to preserve the history of the era, no matter how many anomalies they have to kill (up to and including the Touken Danshi themselves). 

Characterized by their [b]blue[/b] [[aura]] and insane difficulty.

h4.Characters
* [[Enemy Uchigatana]]
* [[Enemy Tachi]]
* [[Enemy Ootachi]]
* [[Enemy Yari]]
* [[Enemy Naginata]]
* [[Enemy Nagaeyari]]

title: meat_jersey_girl
body:
An [[original]] character created by [[Mado (mukade tou)]]. 

A [[guro]]-oriented [[monster girl]], with [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]], a [[yellow eyes|yellow]] [[one-eyed|eye]] (usually just one), and a massive pile of tumor-like [[flesh]] (with bits of bone and metal) that emerges from behind her. She can manipulate this flesh into different useful forms, apparently at will.

title: jc_denton
body:
The main protagonist of the first person [[cyberpunk]] action/RPG [[video game]], [[Deus Ex]] (2000).

[b]J.C. Denton[/b] is an advanced nanotechnological [[cyborg]] in the year 2053. 

He is a black haired young man who uses [[sunglasses]] to conceal his eyes, since the augmentation he possess causes them to shine with an unnatural blue light.

h4. See also

* [[Adam Jensen]]

title: cthulhu
body:
[b]Cthulhu[/b] is a fictional cosmic entity created by horror author [[h_p_lovecraft|H. P. Lovecraft]] in 1926, first appearing in the short story "The Call of Cthulhu" when it was published in Weird Tales in 1928.

Cthulhu is one of the central Great Old Ones of the [[Cthulhu Mythos]]. It is often cited for the extreme descriptions given of its hideous appearance (which includes green skin, gargoyle wings and a squid shaped head), its gargantuan size, and the abject insanity inducing terror that it evokes on the persons unlucky enough to watch him.

title: younger_sister_(elona)
body:
A minor semi-hidden character in [[Elona]], the Younger Sister can be found either in the hidden "Mansion of Younger Sister", where a younger sister merchant sells homemade lunches, (that restore Sanity that you might lose after casting magic while confused or fighting the [[Cthulhu Mythos]]-inspired enemies in the game,) or else by reading a "Little Sister's Diary", which causes a Younger Sister to appear in your party.  (The latter is a reference to [[Chokotto Sister]], where the main character gets a "younger sister" for Christmas from Santa, complete with a notebook/diary instructing her on how to be a good one.)

In game, Younger Sisters appear with random names, as in, "Anita, the younger sister". Because there is no single name, just the "class" name is used.

Younger Sister appears with green twin pigtails with yellow ribbons and a red dress.  She's also often much shorter than most other characters in a work.

title: wanijima_akito
body:
A character from the manga [[Air Gear]] by [[Oogure Ito]].
He is known as The Fang King of the Blood Road, and he has a [[dual persona|split-personality]]. His other persona being [[Wanijima Agito]].

Akito's presence can be visibly seen by his eyepatch, which is worn on the [b]right eye[/b].

He is very non-violent and innocent, he displays a great kindness toward others (especially toward [[Itsuki Minami|Ikki]]). Around his brother Kaito - he seems to show a small fear, but deep love for him. Since he and Agito are one in the same, he is gladly apart of Team Kogarasumaru.

title: itsuki_minami
body:
The main protagonist of the manga [[Air Gear]] by [[Oogure Ito]]. Known as "Ikki" by his friends; and given nicknames such as "Baby Face" and "Lil Crow" by other Air Trek Riders.

Ikki is free spirited and has a natural affiliation for being in the sky, he can be very eccentric and pushy, but does focus on the goals he wants to achieve. He stays with the Noyamano family, whom he lives with due to his parents' deaths. It was the Noyamano sisters who gave Ikki his first pair of ATs.

He formed his own Team called "Kogarasumaru (小烏丸)". Which consist of his friends: Mikura Kazuma "Kazu", Onigiri, Issa Mihotoke "Buccha", [[Wanijima Agito]], and Adachi Emily.

As the story moves on, Ikki is considered a candidate to be Sky King; later he moves onto a road for himself - as the Storm King.

title: wanijima_agito
body:
A character from the manga [[Air Gear]] by [[Oogure Ito]].
He is known as The Fang King of the Blood Road, and he has a [[dual persona|split-personality]]. His other persona being [[Wanijima Akito]].

Agito's presence can be visibly seen by his eyepatch, which is worn on the [b]left eye[/b].

He is very violent and disrespectful toward others, except when he is around his brother Kaito. Yet later in the series he actually develops some form of respect for [[Itsuki Minami|Ikki]], he even ends up joining Team Kogarasumaru.

title: noyamano_ringo
body:
A character from the manga [[Air Gear]] by [[Oogure Ito]].

She is in Team Sleeping Forest (眠りの森, Nemuri no Mori), and is later dubbed Thorn Queen, of the Sonia Road.

Her teammates (who are also her sisters) are [[Noyamano Rika]], [[Noyamano Mikan]], [[Noyamano Shiraume]].

She developed a crush on [[Itsuki Minami|Ikki]] which gradually turned into love, though she dare not confront him about it. While Ikki is oblivious to it.

During Ikki's AT battles, Ringo created an alter-ego called [[Croissant Mask]]- to help out Team Kogarasumaru.

h4. Hagane (鋼音)

A collective name for a group of derivative [[Vocaloid]] characters illustrated by [[Hanji (Hansi)]] (aka. Hansi) and [[Momopanda]]. The characters are based on the Vocaloids produced by Crypton Future Media, given a heavy metal persona and also known as Type-H or Type-M by their respective artist.

Only Hagane Miku's surname is shared by both artists. And it is Momopanda that has created Internet Co. Ltd based Hagane types.

title: planetarian
body:
planetarian ～ちいさなほしのゆめ～ ("Planetarian: [i]Chiisana Hoshi no Yume[/i]", "Planetarian: The Dream of a Little Planet") is a [[science fiction]] visual novel developed by [[key_(company)|Key]]. Because it offers no choices or alternate endings, Visual Art's co.,ltd (the publisher) calls it a Kinetic Novel. It was adapted into a light novel and [[drama CD]]s. 

It was later ported to the [[Playstation 2]]. 

A [[Playstation Portable]] version has also been developed: 
planetarian～ちいさなほしのゆめ～ 東北地方太平洋沖地震被災地チャリティー版 
("Planetarian ~Chiisana Hoshi no Yume~ Special Edition for Tohoku Earthquake"). As the name implies, sales proceeds go directly to helping victims of the 2011 Japan earthquake and tsunami disaster. 

h4.Characters 

* "[[Junker]]" ([i]Kuzuya[/i], the nameless protagonist) 
* [[Hoshino Yumemi]] (aka. [[Reverie]]) 
* [[Mk43L/e]] Auto Gunner (aka. shiomaneki/fiddler crab) 

h4.Novel characters 

* [[Kurahashi Satomi]]

* [[Sergeant major Murdoch]]

title: valkyrie_(p&d)
body:
A set of visually similar characters from [[Puzzle & Dragons]] based on Norse Valkyries. Initially the Valkyries use a [[sword]] and [[shield]]. They later [[dual wielding|dual wield]] swords in their second-to-last forms and start to become more visual distinct from one another. In their finals forms they have a distinct weapon, gain a name, and are more distinct visually.

Subtypes:

* [[light_valkyrie_(p&d)|Light Valkyrie]] (ultimate form: Divine Law Goddess, Valkyrie Rose)
* [[dark_valkyrie_(p&d)|Dark Valkyrie]] (ultimate form: Black-Winged Goddess, Valkyrie Claire)
* [[water_valkyrie_(p&d)|Water Valkyrie]] (ultimate form: Azure Goddess, Valkyrie Reine)
* [[wood_valkyrie_(p&d)|Wood Valkyrie]] (ultimate form: Thorned Goddess, Valkyrie Elize)
* [[fire_valkyrie_(p&d)|Fire Valkyrie]] (ultimate form: Phoenix Goddess, Valkyrie Femme)

title: krizalid
body:
The mid and final boss of King of Fighters '99. He was created as a clone of K', but Krizalid refuses to believe this and thinks that K' is his clone.

He also believed that he is [[Whip (KoF)|Whip]]'s brother, thanks to having K's memories while cloning him. He was ordered to activate thousands of [[Kusanagi Kyou|Kyo]] clones around the world with his suit.

In order to gather the battle data necessary for the activation period, he fights the winning team of the tournament. After his defeat, his superior, [[Zero (KoF)|Zero]] neutralizes the Kyo clones and kills Krizalid by throwing a boulder to crush him. [[Heidern]] inquires if Krizalid remembers his real name. He simply cannot remember and dies shortly after.

He is revived later by the original [[Original Zero|Zero]] and fights alongside him in the [[the King of Fighters 2001|2001 tournament]]. What happened to him following the battle is unknown. He has yet to make another canonical appearance since then.

Some fanarts depict Krizalid paired with [[Touhou]]'s [[Hong Meiling]], due to the fact that one of her Skill cards resembles his Typhoon Rage.

title: dipodal_saucer
body:
A character from the [[Strider (video game)]] franchise. It appears in the original Strider arcade videogame from 1989 as well as the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series of fighting games released years later.

The [b]Dipodal Saucer[/b] (also known as [b]Option A[/b]) is a small mushroom shaped type of floating combat [[robot]] with two legs that helps the main character [[Strider Hiryuu]] during his quest. These robots are very maneuverable and move very fast, can generate energy rings which obliterate the enemies and have a minimal hovering capacity thanks to their micro antigravity generators.

h4. See also

* [[Tetrapodal Mecha Panther]]

title: spiral_power
body:
Spiral Power, otherwise known as Spiral Energy, is a positive supernatural energy that defies the law of Conservation of Energy. In simple terms, it is energy that is produced from essentially nothing and can transform into matter. It is the energy manifestation of "fighting spirit" (i.e. the will to evolve, to advance, or to survive) of sentient organisms bearing double-helix DNA.

Spiral Power is often associated with drills, which symbolize the will to "move forward" from which Spiral Energy is produced, and is exclusive to the anime [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann|Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]].

Should be used to tag posts that either:

A) Feature a character with glowing green spiral eyes
B) Feature a display of power or energy with a spiral motif ([[drill|drills]] and [[kamina shades]] optional)

title: lily_(vocaloid)
body:
Lily is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Internet Co., Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 

She is also a part of an animated band, anim.o.v.e, which is based on the real life band Japanese m.o.v.e., that features lead vocalist Masuda Yuri. Her appearance was illustrated by [[Kei (Keigarou)|KEI]]. She wears a [[revealing clothes|skimpy black top]], [[thigh boots]], and a white and yellow [[skirt]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and a wrist [[tattoo]].

Her accessories are black [[headphones]] and a [[belt]] with a [[cd]] strapped around it.

title: kotegiri_gou
body:
A [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] character. He is the personification of the sword Kotegiri. 

Historically, he was a [[wakizashi]] forged by the swordsmith Gou no Yoshihiro. He has been passed between the Inaba and Hosokawa clans for generations.

In the game, however, Kotegiri has the air of an assistant. He is also a bit of a fashionista, and has a habit of dressing people up and making things look presentable. He aspires to be an idol singer.

He has short [[black hair]] with [[green eyes]], of which there are two moles [[mole_under_eye|under his right eye.]] He wears a green [[military uniform]] and black [[sode]], as well as, fitting enough, [[kote]]. Despite his dream to be an idol, due to his serious appearance, orderly uniform, and [[glasses]] resembling that of an archetypal student council president, he is referred to as "Seitokaichou" by fans.

Voiced by Hirose Yuuya. Artist is [[nitaka (fujikichi)]].

title: cecilia_lynne_adelhyde
body:
One of the three main protagonists of [[Wild Arms 1]]. She is playable in both games. She also makes a minor cameo in [[Wild Arms 5]].

Cecilia is the princess of Adelhyde who has the ability to communicate with Filgaia's Guardians. She is studying magic in Curan Abbey when one of the Guardians warns her of an impending threat to Filgaia. Despite her role as a princess, Cecilia wants to be an ordinary young woman, prompting her to join [[Rody Roughnight]] and [[Jack Van Burace]] in their adventures.
other_names: セシリア・レイン・アーデルハイド

title: elmina_niet
body: [[Jack Van Burace]]'s love interest in [[Wild Arms 1]]. She was one of the Fenril Knights, representing the Sword. When the Metal Demons attacked Arctica Castle, she was taken and brainwashed into Lady Harken.

title: wild_arms_2
body:
The sequel to the original PS1 Wild Arms game (a.k.a. [[Wild Arms 1]]), produced in 2000 by Media Vision. It is available on the PlayStation Network for the Playstation 3 and Playstation Portable. While several elements from the original are borrowed for the sequel, the story is entirely different.

Wild Arms 2 starts off similar to Wild Arms, assuming control of three separate characters who eventually meet up and undertake missions against the terrorist organization Odessa. The overall story encompasses sacrifice and what it means to be a hero. The original members of the Agile Remote Missions Squad (ARMS) are:

* [[Ashley Winchester]]
* [[Lilka Eleniak]]
* [[Brad Evans]]

Later, two more characters join during the story:

* [[Tim Rhymeless]]
* [[Kanon (Wild Arms 2)]]

In addition, [[Marivel Armitage]] can be recruited as an optional character to unlock various extras.

title: sega_cd
body:
The [b]Sega CD[/b], released as the [b]Mega-CD[/b] (メガCD [i]Mega-Shī Dī[/i]) in most regions outside North America, is an add-on device for the [[Sega Mega Drive]] [[video game]] [[game_console|console]], designed and produced by [[Sega]]. 

As part of the fourth generation of video game consoles, the Sega CD was released in Japan in 1991, North America in 1992 and in Europe and other regions in 1993. The device adds a CD-ROM drive to the Mega Drive console, allowing the user to play CD-based games and providing additional hardware functionality. Other benefits of the add-on include a faster central processing unit and graphic enhancements. It can also play audio CDs and CD+G discs. The main benefit of the new add-on's technology was its larger disc space, allowing for larger games to be developed. This would manifest itself in the form of full motion video (FMV) games.

By the end of 1994, the add-on had sold approximately 2.7 million units worldwide. In 1995, it was announced that Sega's support would shift away from the Mega Drive and Sega CD to focus on its new console, the [[Sega Saturn]], and the add-on itself was officially discontinued in 1996. 

Retrospective reception to the add-on is mixed, praising the Sega CD for its individual offerings and additions to the Mega Drive's functions, but criticizing the game library as a whole for its lack of depth and low value for money, as well as issues with how the add-on was supported by Sega.

title: heavy_barrel
body:
[b]Heavy Barrel[/b] (ヘビー・バレル [i]Hebī Bareru[/i]) is a 1987 overhead shooting arcade [[video game]] by [[Data East]]. The game is set in the near future when two lone special unit commandos try to infiltrate a secret [[radiation symbol|nuclear]] [[missile]] complex that was captured by hi-tech enemy paramilitary forces. 

The name of the game comes from an in-game super weapon. The "Heavy Barrel" is a very powerful high-energy portable plasma [[cannon]] capable of destroying any enemy in the game with a single shot. The weapon has a wide arc of fire and can be fired as fast as the player's trigger finger permits, but after thirty seconds its use is exhausted, at which point the bearer reverts to his previous weaponry. It can be found scattered in six pieces hidden among random power-up containers during the game.

Heavy Barrel was ported to the Apple II Pc and DOS in 1989. The [[NES]] and [[Famicom]] versions were developed by Sakata SAS and published by Data East in North America and Japan in 1990. In February 2010, Majesco Entertainment released a port of Heavy Barrel for the [[Nintendo]] [[Wii]] as part of the "Data East Arcade Classics" disc.

title: keith_wayne
body:
A recurring character in the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku|Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series from [[atlus|Atlus]]. 

Keith Wayne is a brash and egotistical youth who competes in the Gouketsuji tournaments and tends to flirt with pretty girls so he can date them. He also used to run in a gang, but due to the feelings of his father, he quit. In later entries, it's implied that he and [[annie_hamilton|Annie Hamilton]] are a couple.

His son is [[chris_wayne|Chris Wayne]], who was featured in [[groove_on_fight|Groove On Fight]].

title: princess_sissy
body:
A character in the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku|Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series.

She was the final boss of [i]Shin Gouketsuji Ichizoku: Toukon Matrimelee[/i]. She is a princess from a land called "Certain Country" and uses a magical box and hidden weapons to fight her opponents. She is polite and formal, but can have a mean and trickster side.

She also has an older brother named Prince who was made a playable character in [i]Gouketsuji Ichizoku Matsuri Senzo Kuyou[/i].

title: thin_nen
body:
A recurring character in the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku|Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series.

He is a corrupt and greedy Buddhist monk whose desires center solely on food, money, and women, and uses tricky and powerful attacks to fight his opponents. He is generally considered a parody of monk characters. He was renamed "Chinnen" since [[Matrimelee|Shin Gouketsuji Ichizoku: Toukon Matrimelee]].

title: hattori_saizou
body:
破鳥 才蔵

A recurring character in the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku|Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series from [[Atlus]].

Saizo Hattori is a ninja who is a sociopath, and makes attempts to try and become a more socially acceptable person through the series. He often has a habit of wearing his helmet and mask to avoid contact with people, and speaks in a code language called "popapepa" so they won't know what he's saying.

His cousin is [[hattori_takumi|Takumi Hattori]], who debuted in the latest game in the series, [i]Gouketsuji Ichizoku Matsuri Senzo Kuyou[/i].

title: ooyama_rin

One of the new characters introduced in [i]Gouketsuji Ichizoku Matsuri Senzo Kuyou[/i] of the [[Gouketsuji Ichizoku|Gouketsuji Ichizoku]] series.

She is a young schoolgirl who uses two forms of karate to fight her opponents and has a very calm and polite personality. She is also the cousin sister of [[ooyama_reiji|Reiji Ooyama]].

title: savoia_s.21
body:
A fictional [[flying boat]] in the [[Studio Ghibli]] movie and manga [[Kurenai no Buta]]. Based on the real-life "Macchi M.33":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macchi_M.33, it is a scarlet-red open-cockpit monoplane with a single overwing-mounted engine, a yellow underside and a fin flash that displays the Royal Italian Air Force [i]tricolore[/i] overlaid with the coat of arms of the city of Genoa.

There are three variations of the S.21. The original version can be seen in post #705377; post #740389 shows the version with the uprated engine and chin-type radiator. This also has provision for seating a single passenger in front. A third version with [[contra-rotating propellers]] was included with a discarded movie epilogue sequence. The S.21 was armed with two 7.92mm [[machine gun|machine guns]].

body:
(紅の豚 くれない　の　ぶた)

A 1992 [[Studio Ghibli]] feature film based on [[Miyazaki Hayao]]'s manga Hikoutei Jidai (飛行艇 時代, "The Age of the Flying Boat"), that was previously serialized in the magazine Model Graphix. Set in the 1920s, it is about a bounty hunter in the Adriatic who, transformed into a pig, makes a living by hunting down air pirates in the region. It is also known by the title "Porco Rosso."

body:

His character design apparently draws from period film stars such as Errol Flynn, with his thin mustache, square jawline, and short brown hair. His flying uniform mimics the color scheme of his plane--yellow [[scarf]], blue [[jacket]] and trousers, and white [[gloves]], [[belt]] and [[knee boots]].

body:

[i][[Axis Powers Hetalia]][/i]'s [[personification|representation]] of Sweden. A large man with [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Usually seen wearing a dark blue naval uniform and wears [[glasses]].

Seemingly the only character in Hetalia with a confirmed sexuality, Sweden is very close to [[Finland (Hetalia)|Finland]], to the point of referring to him as his 'wife', despite the latter's objections.

title: finland_(hetalia)
body:
"Human" name: [b]Tino Väinämöinen[/b] (Tino Vainamainen)

[i][[Axis Powers Hetalia]][/i]'s [[personification|representation]] of Finland. A young man with [[blonde hair]] and [[purple eyes]] (changed to [[brown eyes|brown]] in the anime). Usually seen wearing a light blue military uniform.

Seems to play the role of [[Santa Claus]] in the Hetalia-verse, since Santa Claus is said to live in northern Finland.

Has a [[dog]] named [[Hana-tamago]]. Some strips feature him, [[Sweden (Hetalia)|Sweden]] and [[Sealand (Hetalia)|Sealand]] (and [[Ladonia (Hetalia)|Ladonia]], after his introduction) in a family-like relationship.
other_names: ティノ・ヴァイナマイネン

title: golden_knight_(elona)
body:
The [[golden_knight_(elona)|Golden Knights]] are the divine servants of [[Opatos of Earth]] in the game [[Elona]], and can become player party members for the faithful of Opatos.  Due to their service to their patron god of strength, they have an absurdly high carrying capacity, capable of carrying an additional 300 kg of weight above and beyond what their stats otherwise would allow them to carry.  

Golden Knights are always female.

Salient characteristics of the Golden Knights are their long, straight [[blonde hair]], their blue-and-white dress, and are often seen carrying a rather massive [[mace]].  

Like most Elona characters, Golden Knight is just a "class name", and a personal name is randomly assigned to them upon spawning.  In-game, they would appear as something like "Omikka the golden knight".

title: shena_the_draw
body:
A minor NPC from [[Elona]], Shena the Draw is a bar hostess from the initial town of Vernis.  (A more literal translation of her name would be "Shina the poster girl".)

Shena wears a brown dress with a white [[apron]], and has a white cloth over her head.  She has [[blonde hair]] in [[twin braids]].

Shena is only relevant to the game for a single early-game quest, and the fact that most Vernis residents will occasionally comment upon her: "Everyone loves Shena's ass" or "You could bounce a quarter off Shena's ass!".  

She also has tangential relation to an artifact throwing weapon called Shena's Panty, which is rarely dropped by nobles at parties. It notably deals confusion and mind damage, rather than normal physical damage.

title: gaiares
body:
[b]Gaiares[/b] (ガイアレス [i]Gaiaresu[/i]) is a Japanese side-scrolling 2D space shooter [[video game]] released in 1990 by Telenet Japan for the [[Sega Mega Drive]] System and subsequently for its American counterpart, the [[Sega Mega Drive]].

The name is supposedly a combination of "Gaia" ([i]Mother Earth[/i]) and a shortened form/abbreviation of the word "rescue" ([i]Res[/i]), which is the main objective of the battle taking place within the storyline.

The game is notable for its music, its graphics and its extremely high level of difficulty. Gaiares also featured one of the most original and unique weapon power-up systems in the shooters genre to date: The "TOZ System", a satellite device that can be fired out like the [[R-Type]] [[bit_(r-type)|"Bit"]], except each time it comes into contact with an enemy, it inherits and learns its weapon configuration. In total there are 18 different weapons to be captured and each one varies depending on the strength meter and the type of enemy.

title: zekrom
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #644 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Dragon/Electric Legendary Pokémon.
Zekrom is a black, bipedal Pokémon resembling a dragon or dinosaur, with dark patches on various portions of its body. It has red scleras, white irises, and black pupils, as well as a small horn-like protrusion on the tip of its snout. Its head sports a thundercloud-like crest tipped with light-blue coloration. There are six pairs of pointed teeth visible when its mouth is open, two in the upper jaw and four in the lower. At the base of its neck is a black, stud-like feature, and atop its shoulders are similar, larger features resembling armor padding. The bases of its wings also have such padding, and a fanned, splayed, seemingly webbed shape with a small "wing-spike" on one edge. The lower length of Zekrom's arms extenuate into splayed, seemingly webbed, somewhat baseball-mitt-like formations, with three-clawed, dark-colored hands on the undersides. The front portion of Zekrom's waist is black-colored, with its belly and thighs having thin striations down their length. Its knees are black, as are the foremost parts of its three-clawed feet and spiked heels.
It appears on the box art of [[pokemon_(game)|Pokémon]] [[Pokemon BW|White]]. 

Alongside [[Reshiram]] and [[Kyurem]] it is part of the "Tao Trio":http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Tao_trio.

It does not evolve from or into another Pokémon.
Japanese Name: [b]Zekrom[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Reshiram]]
Next Pokémon: [[Landorus]]

title: mc.200_saetta
body:
An early [[World War II|World War II]] Italian fighter-bomber, the MC.200 [i]Saetta[/i] ("Lightning") was a single-seat low-wing monoplane that first flew in 1937. Its radial engine gave it a distinctive appearance, as did the raised pilot's seat and semi-enclosed canopy. It could carry up to 320 kg (705 lbs) of bombs underwing and was armed with 2 12.7mm machine guns.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* [[MC.202 Folgore]]
* [[MC.205 Veltro]]
* Wikipedia: "Macchi MC.200":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macchi_MC.200
* "Italian Aircraft of World War II: Macchi MC.200 Saetta":http://www.century-of-flight.net/Aviation%20history/photo_albums/timeline/ww2/Macchi%20MC.200%20Saetta.htm

title: ju_88
body:
A versatile twin-engined [[World War II|World War II]] multirole [[airplane]] used mainly by Germany. Its crew was grouped closely together in a many-faceted "beetle eye" cockpit.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junkers_Ju_88

title: ar_196
body:
Single-engine floatplane used in [[World War II|World War II]] by the German Navy as a reconnaissance and patrol aircraft. The twin-pontoon [[seaplane]] was powered by a "radial engine":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radial_engine and had a crew of two under a long greenhouse canopy. Armament included 2 [[machine gun|machine guns]], 2 wing [[cannon]], and 2 50kg (110 lb) bombs.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Arado Ar 196":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arado_Ar_196

title: fw_200
body:
Four-engined [[airplane]] developed by German company Focke-Wulf Flugzeugbau AG just prior to the outbreak of [[World War II|World War II]] as a long-range airliner. The war saw the militarization of the Condor with the addition of underwing hardpoints, bomb bays and defensive gun emplacements. It was used in reconnaissance, anti-shipping, troop transport, and cargo carrier roles.

h4. See also

* Wikipedia: "Focke-Wulf Fw 200 Condor":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Focke-Wulf_Fw_200
* Youtube: "silent clip of pre-war Fw 200 Condor airliner":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PQ9KntTSyG0

title: ta_152
body:
A further development of the German [[World War II|World War II]] [[Fw 190]], designed by Kurt Tank and built by Focke-Wulf. It was originally intended to produce at least three versions, but only a few of the the slender-winged H-series high-altitude interceptor went into service in 1945, too late to have any serious effect on the war.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Focke-Wulf Ta 152":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Focke-Wulf_Ta_152

title: b-25_mitchell
body:
Twin-engined medium [[bomber]] used in [[World War II|World War II]] by Allied air forces. The H-tailed B-25 employed either freefall bombs or forward-firing [[cannon]] or [[machine gun|machine guns]] for surface attack. A few variants were used in maritime patrol and reconnaissance roles.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "North American B-25 Mitchell":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_American_B-25_Mitchell

title: ju_52
body:
A three-engined [[airplane]] built by German manufacturer Junkers in the 1930s. The Ju 52 served in civilian and [[military]] roles as an airliner, freighter, and [[World War II|World War II]] troop transport. It was notable for its use of corrugated "duralumin":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duralumin skin. The military version had 2 [[machine gun|machine guns]] for self-defense.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Junkers Ju 52":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junkers_Ju_52

title: avia_s-92
body:
A twin-engine [[jet]] fighter built in Czechoslovakia immediately after [[World War II|World War II]]. Basically a slightly upgraded [[Me 262]],  all surviving aircraft were removed from service in 1951, when more advanced Soviet jets entered the inventory.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* "S-92 Turbina":http://www.millionmonkeytheater.com/S-92.html

title: cant_z.506
body:
Twin-float Italian [[seaplane]] that was used in [[World War II|World War II]] as a bomber, air-sea rescue, and reconnaissance craft. It was powered by 3 radial engines and had a wooden fuselage and wings, while its floats were of "duralumin":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duraluminium. A crew of five could defend themselves with 4 machine guns; offensive armament included up to 1,200 kg (2,600 lb) of ordnance or 1 [[torpedo]].

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "CANT Z.506":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cant_Z.506

body:
Artist, illustrator, mangaka and game designer, known for his pen-and-paper RPGs including "Tenra Bansho(u),":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tenra_War "Angel Gear":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Japanese_role-playing_games_by_genre#Modern.2FNear_Future and "Alshard.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alshard 

Name as a [[doujinshi]] artist: 希有馬 or けうま (Keuma)
Mainly-used nickname: 井上 純弌 (Inoue Jun'ichi)
Real name: 井上 純一 (Inoue Jun'ichi)
Circle name: 希有馬屋 (Keumaya or Keuma-ya)

His nickname was frequently mistaken for 井上淳弐 (Inoue Junji). So, he decided to use 井上純一 for "his 'Chinese Wife' comic book":http://blog.livedoor.jp/geek/archives/51282205.html published by Enterbrain. He actually used the name "Inoue Junji" in his very early days, though.

For his [[artist self-insert]] or some other artists' [[real life insert]], use this character tag: [[Inoue_Jun'ichi]]

title: fever_macross
body: [[Pachinko]] game based on [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] produced by Sankyo Company and released during 2009 in [[Japan]].

title: tehmzin
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] series. He appears in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008.

[b]Tehmzin[/b] is an alien [[Zentradi]] [[giant]] [[warrior]] who looks a lot like [[Quamzin Kravshera]] from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982. He is also a [[cyborg]].

title: elmo_kridanik
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] universe.

He appears in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV anime series from 2008 and its 2009 animated movie adaptation, [[Macross Frontier: Itsuwari No Utahime]]. 

[b]Elmo Kridanik[/b] is a middle aged [[purple hair]]ed [[Zentradi]] who wears glasses. He is [[Ranka Lee]]'s artistic manager.

He is a [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross|Space War I]] veteran.

title: douglas_quaid
body: The main protagonist of the 1990 [[science fiction]] film [[Total Recall]]. Played by actor [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]].

title: plasma_sword
body: A type of [[science fiction]] sword that uses [[plasma]] energy (an extremely high temperature ionized gas) to cut through anything.

title: transformers_shattered_glass
body:
A [[science fiction]] series from the [[Transformers]] franchise.

[b]Transformers: Shattered Glass[/b] is the fictional multiverse and associated toys and storylines that sprung from BotCon 2008's initial exclusive toyset and comic. 

It is a Transformers take on the old sci-fi warhorse of an evil alternate universe, (akin to [[Star Trek]]'s Mirror Universe and [[DC comics]]' Earth-Three) where the [[decepticon|bad guys]] are good, the [[autobot|good guys]] are bad, and (mostly) everyone has different paint schemes. 

It comes complete with facial hair for the evil versions of certain good guys.
other_names: シャッタード・グラス

title: gamilas
body:
"ガミラス ([i]Gamilas[/i])" a.k.a. [b]"Gamilon"[/b].

A humanoid [[blue skin]]ned militaristic [[alien]] race. Also the name of their planet of origin and their galactic empire, which encompases several different planets and other alien races. 

The [b]Gamilas[/b] are the main antagonists in the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] and the [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato 2199]] [[Science fiction]] anime series.

title: emeraldas
body:
A fictional [[science fiction]] character from the [[Harlock Saga]] series created by [[Matsumoto Leiji]].

[b]Pirate Queen Emeraldas[/b] is a strong and powerful privateer. She appears in the anime [[Queen Emeraldas]].

title: ginga_senpuu_braiger
body:
[b]Galaxy Cyclone Braiger[/b] (銀河旋風ブライガー, [i]Ginga Senpuu Buraigaa[/i]) is a [[mecha]] anime [[Science fiction]] series that aired from 1981 to 1982 in Japan. There were 39 episodes released. 

Other loosely translated names of this series include "Braiger", "Bryger", "Brygar", "Galactic Whirlwind Bryger", "Galactic Cyclone Buraiger" and "Cosmo Runner". 

It is the first series from the [[J9 Series]].

h4. Braiger First Opening Theme

* http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BRHQjqtojwI

title: ginga_reppuu_baxingar
body:
[b]Galactic Gale Baxingar[/b] (銀河烈風バクシンガー, [i]Ginga Reppū Bakushingā[/i]) is a [[mecha]] anime [[Science fiction]] series that aired from 1982 to 1983 in Japan. There were 39 episodes released. 

Other loosely translated names include "Baxinger", "Galactic Stormwind Baxinga" and "Cosmo Rangers". It is the sequel to [[ginga_senpuu_braiger|Braiger]] and the second of the [[J9 Series]]. 

The plot of Baxingar is based in the japanese late Tokugawa period and the story of the Shinsengumi [[samurai]].

h4. Baxinger Opening Theme

* http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dz5PrnCFTw8

title: uchuu_kyoudai
body:
[b]Space Brothers[/b] (宇宙兄弟, [i]Uchū Kyōdai[/i]) is a Japanese [[Science fiction]] manga series by Koyama Chūya which has been serialized in Kodansha's Weekly Morning since January 2008. 

The plot tells the story of [[Nanba Hibito]] and [[Nanba Mutta]], two brothers who become involved in [[space]] exploration.

It has been nominated twice for the Manga Taishō, in 2009 and 2010. In 2011, it won the award for best general manga at the 56th Shogakukan Manga Awards and at the Kodansha Manga Award (shared with Umino Chica's [[March Comes in Like a Lion]]). 

An anime adaptation by A-1 Pictures began airing in Japan from April 1, 2012. 

It was also adapted into a live action film that premiered on May 5, 2012.

title: meredith_vickers
body:
A character from the 2012 [[science fiction]] horror film [[prometheus_(movie)|Prometheus]]. She is played by [[South African]] actress [[Charlize Theron]].

[b]Meredith Vickers[/b] is a [[weyland-yutani|Weyland]] Corporation representative who is in charge of the [i]Prometheus[/i] mission.

title: dredd
body:
A 2012 [[Science fiction]] [[Cyberpunk]] action film based in the character [[Judge Dredd]] from the [[2000 AD]] comics.

h4. See also

* [[Judge Anderson]]

title: 2000_ad
body:
A [[Science fiction]] comics anthology magazine from England.

[b]2000 AD[/b] is a weekly British science fiction-oriented comic. As a comics anthology it serialises a number of separate stories each issue (known as "progs") and was first published by IPC Magazines in 1977, the first issue dated 26 February. IPC then shifted the title to its Fleetway comics subsidiary which was sold to Robert Maxwell in 1987 then Egmont UK in 1991. Fleetway continued to produce the title until 2000, when it was bought by Rebellion Developments.

It is most noted for its [[Judge Dredd]] stories, and has been contributed to by a number of artists and writers who became renowned in the field internationally, such as Alan Moore, Neil Gaiman, Grant Morrison, Bryan Talbot, Brian Bolland and Mike McMahon. Other notable characters in 2000 AD include [[Judge Anderson]], [i]Rogue Trooper[/i], [i]Strontium Dog[/i] and [i]ABC Warriors[/i].

h4. See also

* [[Dredd]]

title: judge_dredd
body:
A fictional [[Science fiction]] [[Cyberpunk]] character from the [[2000 AD]] comics and the 2012 [[Dredd]] film.

[b]Judge Joseph Dredd[/b] is a an American law enforcement officer in a massive violent city of the future ([[Mega-City One]]) where uniformed heavy armored and armed "Judges" combine the powers of [[police]], judge, jury and executioner. Dredd and his fellow Judges are empowered to arrest, sentence, and even execute criminals on the spot. 

The character was created by writer John Wagner and artist Carlos Ezquerra, although editor Pat Mills also deserves some credit for early development.

Judge Dredd is amongst the UK's best known home-grown comic characters. So great is the character's name recognition that his name is sometimes invoked over similar issues to those explored by the comic series, such as the police state, authoritarianism, and the rule of law. 

Judge Dredd was named the Seventh Greatest Comic Character by the British magazine Empire. In 2011, IGN ranked him 35th in the Top 100 Comic Book Heroes.

h4. See also

* [[Lawgiver]]
* [[Judge Anderson]]

* [[RoboCop]]

title: judge_anderson
body:
A fictional [[Science fiction]] [[Cyberpunk]] character from the [[2000 AD]] and the [[Dredd]] 2012 film. 

Like her mythical namesake [i]Cassandra[/i] (the character from [i]The Iliad[/i] that could see the future), [b]Judge Cassandra Anderson[/b] has psychic powers. In addition to being able to sense approaching danger and foresee events of the near future, as did her namesake, she also has telepathy. This allows her to read other people's minds and use mental attacks. These abilities allowed her to be a member of [[Mega-City One]]'s corps of "Judges" as member of the Psi Division, which includes all Judges possessing psychic abilities.

Anderson started as a supporting player in the comic stories of [[Judge Dredd]] from 2000 AD and eventually rose in prominence and became the star of her own series, which are entitled [i]Anderson: Psi-Division[/i]. 

She was created by writer John Wagner and artist Brian Bolland in 1980. Since 1988, Anderson has been written almost exclusively by Alan Grant, often working with artist Arthur Ranson.

title: mega-city_one
body:
A fictional massive and futuristic, crime infested decaying city from the [[2000 AD]] [[Science fiction]] [[Cyberpunk]] comic series and the 2012 [[Dredd]] film.

[b]Mega-City One[/b] is a huge fictional city-state covering much of what is now the Eastern United States in the [[Judge Dredd]] comic book series and its spinoff series. 

The exact geography of the city depends on which writer and artist has done which story, but from its first appearance it has been associated with New York City's urban sprawl; originally it was presented as a future New York, which was retconned as the centre of a "Mega-City One" in the very next story.

The city evolved out of a growing urban conurbation stretching from Boston to Washington, which took form in the 21st century to cope with the escalating population crisis in America and - due to the high crime rate - led to the introduction of the "Judge" system.

title: contra:_shattered_soldier
body:
[b]Contra: Shattered Soldier[/b], published in Japan as [b]Shin Contra[/b] (真魂斗羅?, [i]"True Contra"[/i]) is a [[military]] [[Science fiction]] shooter [[video game]] that is part of the [[Contra]] series by [[Konami]]. 

It was developed by Team Kijirushi, a group of staff members within Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo, and released for the [[PlayStation 2]] in 2002. 

The game marks a return to the two-dimensional gameplay style employed by the series prior to [i]Contra: Legacy of War[/i].

h4. See also

* [[lucia_(contra)|Lucia]]

title: neo_contra
body:
[b]Neo Contra[/b] (ネオコントラ?) is the tenth [[video game]] in the [[Contra]] [[military]] [[Science fiction]] shooter series by [[Konami]]. 

It was developed by Team Neo Kijirushi, a group of staff members within Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo, and released for the [[PlayStation 2]] in 2004. 

The game is a direct follow-up to [[Contra: Shattered Soldier]] and is another departure from the traditional scrolling shooter formula from previous games by setting the action in overhead 3D stages.

h4. See also

* [[Bill Rizer]]
* [[yagyuu_jaguar_genbei|Genbei Yagyu]]

body:
Electronic Fleet Admiral "Ouka"

A world where, following surrender terms more favorable to Japan at the end of World War II, the Great Empire of Japan continues to exist in a peaceful world——— In the Imperial Japanese Navy of this world, humaniform machines called command computers exist to control combat machinery such as ships and fighters. In Jinmu era 2664 (A.D. 2004), a humaniform computer named Ouka assumes comand of the combined fleet as its admiral.

title: myouga_(plant)
body:
Myouga (茗荷) is an edible ginger plant. 

[[nishida_satono|Nishida Satono]] of the [[touhou|Touhou]] series is depicted as holding a myouga plant in her left hand, similar to the character she is named after, Nishida, who was a servant of Matarajin and is also depicted with a myouga plant.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myoga

title: whiteholian
body:
A character that appears in the [i][[Uchuu Patrol Luluco]][/i] soundrack in Episode 13.5. [spoiler] She is an inhabitant of the planet the [[Blackholian]] and [[Alpha Omega Nova]] land on after the fallout of episode 13. Despite being reluctant at first, the Blackholian falls in love with her. [/spoiler]

Her official design "can be found":[http://i.imgur.com/bNcYC6o.jpg] in the [i]Art of Trigger[/i] book for the series.

title: rubber_gloves
body:
Disposable [[gloves]] made out of rubber, worn when having to handle chemicals or performing unsanitary tasks such as changing diapers, cleaning toilets, and dishwashing. Rubber is not used for medical purposes - those gloves are made out of different polymers such as [[latex]], nitrile, vinyl and neoprene.
